reviews.title: A mixed bag of nuts...

reviews.text: On a short business trip spent two nights at the hotel. Due to meetings and midnight flights I could only sleep for three or four hours and had no time to enjoy the amenities. Anyhow, the overall impression was positive, lobby is impressive, the materials and designs are first class. The staff is friendly. Check-in and out efficient. Room was nice, quiet and comfortable, slippers, ironing board, international television, I ordered room breakfast, was punctutal on the minute. A drawback was that the telephone did not function when I wanted to contact inhouse services. Had a snack at the beergarden in german style, quite funny, the non-german waiters are dressed up in german style, and there is a large screen tv showing English football games. On the terrace and at the german beergarden service is quite slow, not very attentive. Good news for smokers, there are many zones where smoking is permitted.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Hotel adjacent to Sea

reviews.text: I live in DOH and have been a member at the beach club for nearly two years. Accordingly I am not able to review the rooms, beds or club lounge. I have however used all of the hotel's restaurants and leisure facilities extensively and I hope that my remarks can be of some assistance to travellers.
reviews.title: Great facilities & restaurants

reviews.text: The staff are friendly and service is mainly prompt and efficient, and always friendly.
reviews.title: Helpful staff
Marriott
reviews.text: There are a number of interesting restaurants. JW's steakhouse provides US Angus Prime beef and other delights, including a deliciously sticky fried foie gras with onion marmalade. I greatly enjoy the rich curries served at Taj Rasoi and I always take mine spicy. Food is spiced to order here so those who enjoy spicy, medium or mild can all enjoy their meal. Asia Live, the Mexican Salsa and the seafood buffet are also good.

The pool, which is the main reason I go, is outstanding. It is long, deep and on most days at the perfect temperature for swimming. For those who swim rather than frolic there is no better option in DOH. There is also a wet spa with steam room, hot tub and (great for the summer) a very cold plunge pool.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.text: My wife, her sister, and I stayed for one night at the Doha Marriott as we made brief Qatar stop for the stamp in the passport. I am Platinum Premier with Marriott so we used points. While I stay in hotels over 300 nights per year, this hotel would not upgrade me. And, the hotel was not even half full.
reviews.title: Good Hotel but bad location
An oasis - no surprises
reviews.text: Overall, the hotel is average and everything that people have written in previous reviews holds true. The hotel’s location is horrible. The restaurants at the hotel (which we did not eat) charge prices that make the burj seem affordable. On the upside, check in was fast and the people are friendly.
Some information that might help and may put stuff into perspective.
reviews.title: Superb
It's good -- for Doha. That's not saying a lot
reviews.text: First, taxis. Yes, they want you to use the Marriott’s transportation. No, you really can’t walk anywhere near the hotel and flag a cab. However, they will call the taxi for you. Initially, the front desk person told me it would take three hours. Remember, the hotel front desk person and he is just doing his job. I simply said “no” I need regular taxi. He called the taxi number (central control, I think it’s called) and 30 minutes later, we had a taxi. Another tactic that works is to simply wait out front for a taxi from the airport to drop someone off. Again, we never had to wait more than 20 minutes. BTW, the phone number to the central taxi station is [--]. Call the number and 30 minutes later, you will have a cab at a reasonable price.

reviews.title: Working stay
reviews.text: The beach and pool. Doha is a business place. Not many people go beaching it in Doha. That said, the beach is adequate. It is small, tired, and average in terms of cleanliness. The pool is outstanding. No, it is not a sexy free form pool. It is Olympic in terms of size and shape. And, it has a true deep end.

reviews.title: Nice to be with Marriot
reviews.text: Excellent stay. The guests can feel proud to be with amongst celebrities from around the globe.
Very very clean surrounding and co-operative staff. Though the rates are a bit on higher side the stay is very memorable.
reviews.title: Good Business Hotel

reviews.text: The Marriott is a 10 min drive from the airport and 20 mins from the business district but at times the proximity to the airport can be a pain as its located close to the flight path. There is nothing around the hotel (in terms of local restaurants, grocery stores etc) but the hotel more than compensates with its 5 restaurants. The food, especially Indian is great but can be pricey. The other facilities - business centre, pool, gym etc are excellent. Would keep away from the MAriott if visiting on holiday but a decent business hotel.
